channel.title: Colleges.. Where's a good option
channel.description:
It seems it's about time for me to apply and get my butt accepted into a college before this school year lets out. The hard part is, I don't know where I want to go. My credentials aren't great, and I may not graduate (if that so, I'm getting a GED). I want to major Web Design/Development. No not one or the other, both. So let's lay this out. ACT: 19 SAT: N/A (Assuming the worst scenario) I have a GED. Live in Colorado currently.
Where can I go.
Note: If it's out of state I'd need some form of student housing.
I've been looking at Neumont, but I don't know if it's a good school. AI of Colorado seems to be doing good too. RU (Regis University) has a lot to offer..
What do you guys think? (I'm planning on applying to A LOT, just in case I don't get accepted to where I'd like to go.

Ugh, I hate the 1 word reply shit. That’s not very informative. But it is one of the alternative schools, like I was talking about before.

@sk8rdude461 wrote:

sinisoul:

Oh god 19 ACT, I have a high ACT (32) and I still have a hard time getting into unis because I have a solis 3 GPA. Btw Im from Colorado.

Jesus. When I took the ACT my school was like “Oh nice, 19, you’ll be fine” etc etc. That’s pretty shitty. Then again, my school always has been like that.

item.title: Colleges.. Where's a good option
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

sk8rdude461:

That’s why I’m trying to get into one of those shitty alternative colleges where they are based off the degree, and not the General Arts.

Community is better than alternative, your chances of even getting a job out of an alternative college are not good.

Here is an article I read several months ago about an alternative college in my state:

tampabay.com – 20 Nov 12

Psych major begins life after New College — in Dad's garage

The sign she waved at graduation —

item.title: Colleges.. Where's a good option
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

ziplock:

I’m just telling you what they will tell you if you plan on transferring. I went to CC to get the first two years of Computer Science out of the way. They told me if I wanted a CS degree then I shouldn’t take any CS related classes my first two years because the university would want me to learn those subjects to their standards instead of the CC’s, and if I did take one, then the credit would more than likely not transfer over. So I signed up for a General Art’s degree, which is just a general Associates Degree that get’s all of your basic required classes out of the way so that you don’t have to waste your money paying x4 as much for the same class at a university. It was extremely boring and I’ve survived a semester, although I am not going back this semester because I don’t think I can take it. In conclusion, I hate Community College.

That’s why I’m trying to get into one of those shitty alternative colleges where they are based off the degree, and not the General Arts.

Read full topic

item.title: Colleges.. Where's a good option
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

I’m just telling you what they will tell you if you plan on transferring. I went to CC to get the first two years of Computer Science out of the way. They told me if I wanted a CS degree then I shouldn’t take any CS related classes my first two years because the university would want me to learn those subjects to their standards instead of the CC’s, and if I did take one, then the credit would more than likely not transfer over. So I signed up for a General Art’s degree, which is just a general Associates Degree that get’s all of your basic required classes out of the way so that you don’t have to waste your money paying x4 as much for the same class at a university. It was extremely boring and I’ve survived a semester, although I am not going back this semester because I don’t think I can take it. In conclusion, I hate Community College.

Read full topic

item.title: Colleges.. Where's a good option
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:19, topic:478591”]It’s not a degree in Art, it’s a General Art’s degree, as in, all the non-major specific classes that you have to take. If you plan on transferring, you will most likely need this degree anyways.

Edit:
Unless your community college has a degree plan set-up with a close university that is specific for Science.[/quote]
I’m not even in a college yet, I’m just getting a few credits for it. Granted I’m probably going there next cause I’ll already have credits from there.

Read full topic

item.title: Colleges.. Where's a good option
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

It’s not a degree in Art, it’s a General Art’s degree, as in, all the non-major specific classes that you have to take. If you plan on transferring, you will most likely need this degree anyways.

Edit:
Unless your community college has a degree plan set-up with a close university that is specific for Science.

Read full topic

item.title: Colleges.. Where's a good option
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

ziplock:

If you plan on transferring just get a General Arts degree. It’s boring and really uninteresting but it’s what you will have to do anyways. The university’s prefer to teach your major specific classes, while they don’t really care about your general prerequisites, such as Sociology.

I don’t see why I should get a Art degree when I’m going for a Bachelors in Science…

Read full topic

I’ve signed up to get some RRCC (Red Rocks Community College) Credits through my CTS this semester. How much, I have no clue, but it’s something. Plus, it’s free.
